Uses of Class
react.Connection

    • Uses of Connection in react

      Methods in react that return Connection 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract Connection Connection.atPrio(int priority)
      Changes the priority of this connection to the specified value.
      Connection RList.connect(RList.Listener<? super E> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this list, such that it will be notified on adds and removes.
      Connection RMap.connect(RMap.Listener<? super K,? super V> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this map, such that it will be notified on puts and removes.
      Connection RQueue.connect(RQueue.Listener<? super E> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this queue, such that it will be notified on offers and polls.
      Connection RSet.connect(RSet.Listener<? super E> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this set, such that it will be notified on adds and removes.
      Connection SignalView.connect(SignalView.Listener<? super T> slot)
      Connects this signal to the supplied slot, such that when an event is emitted from this signal, the slot will be notified.
      Connection AbstractSignal.connect(SignalView.Listener<? super T> slot) 
      Connection AbstractValue.connect(SignalView.Listener<? super T> listener) 
      Connection ValueView.connect(SignalView.Listener<? super T> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this value, such that it will be notified when this value changes.
      Connection AbstractValue.connect(Slot<? super T> slot) 
      Connection ValueView.connect(Slot<? super T> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this value, such that it will be notified when this value changes.
      Connection AbstractValue.connect(ValueView.Listener<? super T> listener) 
      Connection ValueView.connect(ValueView.Listener<? super T> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this value, such that it will be notified when this value changes.
      Connection RList.connectNotify(RList.Listener<? super E> listener)
      Invokes onAdd(int,E) for all existing list elements, then connects listener.
      Connection RMap.connectNotify(RMap.Listener<? super K,? super V> listener)
      Invokes onPut for all existing entries and then connects listener.
      Connection RQueue.connectNotify(RQueue.Listener<? super E> listener)
      Invokes onOffer for all existing queue elements, then connects listener.
      Connection RSet.connectNotify(RSet.Listener<? super E> listener)
      Invokes onAdd for all existing elements, and then connects listener.
      Connection AbstractValue.connectNotify(SignalView.Listener<? super T> listener) 
      Connection ValueView.connectNotify(SignalView.Listener<? super T> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this value, such that it will be notified when this value changes.
      Connection AbstractValue.connectNotify(Slot<? super T> slot) 
      Connection ValueView.connectNotify(Slot<? super T> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this value, such that it will be notified when this value changes.
      Connection AbstractValue.connectNotify(ValueView.Listener<? super T> listener) 
      Connection ValueView.connectNotify(ValueView.Listener<? super T> listener)
      Connects the supplied listener to this value, such that it will be notified when this value changes.
      abstract Connection Connection.holdWeakly()
      Changes this connection to one held by a weak reference.
      static Connection Connection.join(Connection... conns)
      Returns a single connection which aggregates all of the supplied connections.
      abstract Connection Connection.once()
      Converts this connection into a one-shot connection.

      Returns a single connection which aggregates all of the supplied connections.
